title: Jamie Carragher reminds Brendan Rodgers of Raheem Sterling penalty term after Sadio Mane incident
text:

Jamie Carragher has reminded former Liverpool boss Brendan Rodgers of his penalty term for a Raheem Sterling after Sadio Mane penalty incident.

The Reds secured a last-gasp victory over Rodgers' current club Leicester on Saturday with James Milner dispatching a penalty in the 95rd minute after Senegalese winger Mane went down under the challenge of Marc Albrighton.

After the defeat to his former club Rodgers said Mane "made the most of the contact" and "if the referee didn't give it, I don't think anyone would say it was a clear and obvious penalty."

Upon hearing Rodgers' view, Reds legend Carragher took to Twitter to remind the Northern Irishman of the penalty term he used previously.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

"Brendan normally calls them “A Spanish penalty!”" Carragher said in a tweet.

The former defenders quote was taken from a post match interview Rodgers had back in 2014 after his then Liverpool side thrashed Stoke 5-3 at the Bet365 Stadium.

During the game, the Reds were given a second half penalty after Raheem Sterling went down under the challenge of Marc Wilson and Rodgers described as "soft".

(Image: Getty Images)

(Image: Getty Images)

“It’s what I call a Spanish penalty, the sort you see in Europe when the contact puts the attacker over,” he said in an interview with CityAM after the match.

“I thought it was soft."

Milner's goal spared the blushes of Liverpool after James Madison equalised with 10 minutes to play in the contest at Anfield.

Liverpool's win means that they maintained their 100% record in the league, with eight wins from eight.

The Reds top the Premier League as we enter the second international break of the season.
description: Former Liverpool defender calls out Rodgers after his comments about Mane incident
